intro: Ghinia boxiana, commonly known as the boxwood plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and western Asia, typically found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage that forms dense, rounded clumps. Its small, white flowers appear in umbels during the spring and summer months. Ghinia boxiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and hardy nature.
